arm_group.description: Performance and safety of tympanostomy tube delivery system

brief_summary.textblock:
This was a non-significant risk (NSR), prospective, multi-center, single arm clinical trial
      that aimed to evaluate safety and performance of the Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery
      System (TTDS).

clinical_study.brief_title: Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System for the Treatment of Patients Requiring Tympanostomy Tube Insertion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosed with either chronic otitis media with effusion (OME) or recurrent acute
             otitis media (AOM) and scheduled to undergo tympanostomy tube insertion

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  History of sensitivity or reaction to anesthesia chosen for the procedure

          -  Markedly atrophic, mono- or bimeric, severely retracted, atelectatic or perforated
             tympanic membrane

          -  Otitis externa

          -  Active acute otitis media

          -  Otitis media pathology requiring T-tubes

          -  Stenosed ear canal

          -  Anatomy that precludes sufficient visualization of and access to the tympanic
             membrane

          -  Anatomy that necessitates tympanostomy tube placement in the posterior half of the
             tympanic membrane

clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study of the Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System for the Treatment of Patients Requiring Tympanostomy Tube Insertion for Otitis Media

primary_outcome.description: The composite endpoint, Ear Outcome Success, is comprised of Device Success with no Safety Events (per ear).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Procedure Success: on per subject basis, is the successful placement of any tympanostomy tube in the absence of Safety Events
Tube Retention: on per device basis, is the presence of a TTDS-placed tympanostomy tube across the tympanic membrane (TM) at the Follow-Up visit

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
